page.title: 04Sandpits in Ardleigh
page.content: {Buckbricks, sandpits in Slough Lane have been there 55 years and Mr. Trew, the man in charge has worked there for 38 years. The 14 full time workers start at 7.30 am and finish at 5 pm. They have to wear protective clothing. {Every month Bucbricks}sell approximately 12,000 tons of both sand and gravel, but in May 1985 they sold 17,617 tons. The sand is first washed in a barrel which has different sized holes to sort out the different grades. Some sand is used for filtration and blasting. {Bucbricks export}sand to the Falkland Islands and to the Middle East. {During the years excavating}they have found a{Roman well,}part of a {whale,}parts of a{furry elephant (a {mammoth)}and a{fossilized sea urchin.
